column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Went on a Saturday morning when it opened to see the Obama portraits. The line to get in
column2: even though we had purchased tickets online
column3: was at least two blocks long. We decided to wait a bit
column4: and went back in 45 minutes and were able to walk in. There is a virtual line to see the Obama portraits and even though it estimated it would be 45 minutes
column5: we got in in 30 minutes.  It was organized and you were not rushed through. Of course
column8: everyone was reasonable. The art Institute has all types of art to view from modern to impressionists. Be prepared for lots of walking
column10: and  lots of stairs. The cafes were still closed due to Covid
column11: so there are no food or drink options.
